review: First let me say that I'm a long time Roku user, so any experience with streaming devices is built around that model.  With that being said, Chromecast will NOT replace a Roku should that be your current streaming device or if you were looking to upgrade from an older Roku model.  However, the Chromecast is a good device for someone who is looking for a simple way to broadcast net content to their television.  The device is very simple to set up and "throwing" a show, music, or webpage from your phone, tablet, or laptop is as simple a pushing a button.  The only disappointment so far has been the lack of supporters in terms of major sites such as Amazon Prime Video, however hopefully that will change over time.  If your looking for something for heavy TV watching (to replace your cable or dish) then use Roku, but if your looking for a fun device that will bring a lot of your home android devices and computers together to your tv then give this a shot.
